title: Pineapple plant

properties.name: description
properties.value: Pineapple plants can be grown by players who have 51 farming, by planting a pineapple seed in a filled plant pot using a gardening trowel, then watering it with a watering can. After 15 minutes or less, the pineapple seedling will become a pineapple sapling and can then be transferred to a Fruit tree patch with a spade. A pineapple sapling may take fourteen hours or more to mature. An Amulet of nature may be bound to the patch to provide progress on its growth. If this tree becomes diseased, using secateurs or magic secateurs on it to prune the diseased leaves will bring it back to a healthy state.

Pineapple plants can be grown by players who have 51 farming, by planting a pineapple seed in a filled plant pot using a gardening trowel, then watering it with a watering can. After 15 minutes or less, the pineapple seedling will become a pineapple sapling and can then be transferred to a Fruit tree patch with a spade. A pineapple sapling may take fourteen hours or more to mature. An Amulet of nature may be bound to the patch to provide progress on its growth. If this tree becomes diseased, using secateurs or magic secateurs on it to prune the diseased leaves will bring it back to a healthy state.

Planting a pineapple tree sapling grants 57 Farming experience. A healthy, fully-grown pineapple plant, when checked, grants 4,605 Farming experience. Once mature, the tree can produce up to six pineapples at a time, which grant 21.5 Farming experience each when picked. Once all six pineapples have been picked, the tree will slowly produce more pineapples until all 6 are available again, which may be picked anytime they show on the tree.

A gardener will watch over a growing pineapple plant in exchange for 10 watermelons, which may be noted.

Farming[edit | edit source]

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • As with pineapples in Old School RuneScape, pineapples in real life do not grow on trees, but rather grow as a small ground plant. Unlike the plants in the game, the real-world plant can produce only a single pineapple before dying.

'''Pineapple plants''' can be grown by players who have 51 [[farming]], by planting a [[pineapple seed]] in a [[filled plant pot]] using a [[gardening trowel]], then watering it with a [[watering can]]. After 15 minutes or less, the [[pineapple seedling]] will become a [[pineapple sapling]] and can then be transferred to a [[Fruit tree patch]] with a [[spade]]. A pineapple sapling may take fourteen hours or more to mature. An [[Amulet of nature]] may be bound to the patch to provide progress on its growth. If this tree becomes diseased, using [[secateurs]] or [[magic secateurs]] on it to prune the diseased leaves will bring it back to a healthy state.

Planting a pineapple tree sapling grants 57 Farming [[experience]]. A healthy, fully-grown pineapple plant, when checked, grants 4,605 Farming experience. Once mature, the tree can produce up to six pineapples at a time, which grant 21.5 Farming experience each when picked. Once all six pineapples have been picked, the tree will slowly produce more pineapples until all 6 are available again, which may be picked anytime they show on the tree.

A [[Group of Advanced Gardeners|gardener]] will watch over a growing pineapple plant in exchange for 10 [[watermelon]]s, which may be noted.

==Trivia==
*As with pineapples in ''[[RuneScape|Old School RuneScape]]'', pineapples in real life do not grow on trees, but rather grow as a small ground plant. Unlike the plants in the game, the real-world plant can produce only a single pineapple before dying.

{{Trees}}
{{Farming plants}}
